questions.text: ___________ are the most common computing devices in the world.
questions.explanation: Smartphones are the most widely used computing devices globally due to their portability and multifunctionality.

questions.text: In data flow diagrams, which of the following may have an ‘illogical’ output from a normal input?
questions.explanation: A gray hole occurs when a process has valid inputs but produces an illogical or invalid output, indicating inconsistent logic.

questions.text: In data flow diagrams, which of the following may have two inputs but no output?
questions.explanation: A black hole process accepts data inputs but produces no outputs, which is logically incomplete.

questions.text: In order for a company to decide on its software development strategy, it has to consider three main key aspects. Which of the following is one of them?
options: The quality and number of the computers
The human resources that are available
questions.explanation: One of the three major factors in deciding a software development strategy is understanding the Internet’s impact on operations and system architecture.

questions.text: In order for a company to decide on its software development strategy, which of the following is not one of the three key aspects?
options: The number of required software developers
questions.correctAnswer: The number of required software developers
questions.explanation: The number of developers is an operational detail, not one of the three strategic aspects of software development decisions.

questions.text: Systems requirements fall under different categories. Under which category does the following statement fall? ‘All students must swipe their student cards in order to gain entry to the building.’
questions.explanation: This describes an input requirement because it involves capturing data (student card swipes) from users.

questions.text: Systems requirements fall under different categories. Under which category does the following statement fall? ‘Because of COVID-19, the library must not accept more than 50 students.’
options: None of the other answers is correct.
questions.explanation: This is a control requirement because it defines a restriction on how the system operates based on a condition.

questions.text: Systems requirements fall under different categories. Under which category does the following statement fall? ‘Student entry to the campus must be captured by students swiping a smart card.’
questions.explanation: This represents an input requirement since it captures data through card swiping at the entry point.

questions.text: Systems requirements fall under different categories. Under which category does the following statement fall? ‘The manager of the sales department must approve orders that exceed a customer's credit limit.’
questions.explanation: This is a control requirement because it sets an authorisation condition on specific actions within the system.

questions.text: Systems requirements fall under different categories. Under which category does the following statement fall? ‘The system must create an error log file that includes the error type, description and time.’
questions.explanation: This is an output requirement because it defines what information the system must generate and display or record.

questions.text: Systems requirements fall under different categories. Under which category does the following statement fall? ‘This student system must provide students with updated marks.’
questions.explanation: This output requirement specifies the data that the system must present to the users — student marks.

questions.text: Which of the following is a step in a cost-benefit analysis checklist?
options: Study the results and prepare a report to management.
For each alternative, identify all costs and benefits.
For each alternative, apply financial analysis tool.
All of the other answers are correct
questions.correctAnswer: All of the other answers are correct
questions.explanation: All listed actions form part of a complete cost-benefit analysis process, from identification to reporting.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a step in a cost-benefit analysis checklist?
options: Study the results and prepare a report for the end user.
For each alternative, identify all costs and benefits.
For each alternative, apply financial analysis tool.
You should consider future growth and the need for scalability.
questions.correctAnswer: You should consider future growth and the need for scalability.
questions.explanation: Scalability assessment is part of technical feasibility, not a step in the cost-benefit analysis checklist.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a value-added service?
questions.explanation: Hardware is a tangible product, not a value-added service like software or support.

questions.text: Which of the following statements is least correct?
options: The second generation of computers enables people to interact much more effectively.
The second generation of computers enables people to collaborate much more effectively.
The second generation of computers enables people to share private information much more effectively.
The second generation of computers enables people to perform routine tasks much more effectively.
questions.correctAnswer: The second generation of computers enables people to share private information much more effectively.
questions.explanation: Private information sharing became more common with later internet-based systems, not during the second generation of computers.
